db:abstract.db:para: A base class to be used to provide textures.
This type was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The AbstractTexture class shouldn't be used directly but rather through one of its subclasses. Each subclass implements a given texture target (2D, 2DArray, 3D, CubeMap ...) Each subclass provides a set of functors for each layer, cube map face and mipmap level. In turn the backend uses those functor to properly fill a corresponding OpenGL texture with data. It is expected the functor does as minimal processing as possible so as not to slow down textures generation and upload. If the content of a texture is the result of a slow procedural generation process, it is recommended not to implement this directly in a functor.
All textures are unique. If you instantiate twice the same texture this will create 2 identical textures on the GPU, no sharing will take place.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] handle : var
db:section.db:para: Holds the current texture handle, if Qt 3D is using the OpenGL renderer, handle is a texture id integer.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] handleType : enumeration
db:section.db:para: Holds the current texture handle type.
